physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Several flesh-colored umbilicated papules on his face and scalp; papules identified histologically as sebaceous adenomas. A papule on his upper cutaneous lip was excised and identified as a sebaceous adenoma with focal atypia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient has undergone excision of 8 sebaceous carcinomas and multiple additional `sebaceous adenomas,` which have increased in number with time, suggesting progression in cutaneous manifestations.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Colonoscopy revealed completely normal findings with no evidence of polyps or malignancy; a chest radiograph showed normal findings. Renal ultrasound revealed normal kidneys.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The findings remained normal after 6 months of follow-up.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Expression of MLH1 was normal, absent expression of MSH2; MSH6 staining was indeterminate, indicative of Muir-Torre syndrome diagnosis.
